entry.title: Fwd: [BIP 15] Aliases
entry.summary: The context revolves around usability issues related to Bitcoin and Namecoin. The person was in a situation where they wanted to pay for a drink using Bitcoin but couldn't scan the QR code on the wall because they didn't have a mobile phone. Instead, they used FirstBits to find the bitcoin address from the website and completed the transaction through their terminal. They then discuss the proposal for Namecoin, which would make Bitcoin implementations dependent on unproven technology. They argue that HTTPS/DNSSEC are better options as they have been around for a long time and have proven to be reliable. Additionally, they mention that Namecoin could die tomorrow and its centralization is not a big issue for end-users. Overall, the context highlights the importance of user-friendly solutions in the world of cryptocurrency.
